sub_topic: Finding the perimeter of a circle.
message_1: What is the perimeter of a circle with a radius of 5 cm? Round your answer to the nearest hundredth.
message_2:
The perimeter of a circle, also known as the circumference, can be calculated using the formula C = 2πr, where C is the circumference and r is the radius.

In this case, the radius (r) is 5 cm. So, the formula becomes:

C = 2π(5)

C ≈ 2 × 3.14 × 5

C ≈ 31.4 cm

So, the perimeter (circumference) of the circle is approximately 31.4 cm, rounded to the nearest hundredth.
